Greetings o great Atatürk! They do not call you "Father Turk" for nothing, as it was your military prowess and will for reform that established and maintained the Republic of Turkey. Forged from the ruins of the Ottoman Empire after World War I, the Republic of Turkey quickly became a power to be reckoned with. It was not that simple, however, as you had to fight the Greeks in order to gain sovereignty. You succeded. Can you, president Kemal, create an empire to stand the test of time?

Mustafa Kemal was the first president of the Republic of Turkey. He was known by his people as Atatürk, "Father Turk," for several reasons. Kemal commanded the Turkish armies after the fall of the Ottoman Turks in a war against Greece. Succeeding, Kemal founded the Republic of Turkey and became a national hero. During his rule, Kemal established a number of reforms, some quite contraversial. Kemal's reforms, known as "Kemalism," were mimicked to an extent by Iran.

The Republic of Turkey was forged from the ruins of the Ottoman Empire. The Ottomans, already weakened, could not handle the consequences of being on the losing side of World War I. Opposed by the Allies, portions of the Ottoman Empire began to rebel. When the Ottomans finally fell, it was Mustafa Kemal who was there to clean up the region. Kemal routed the Greeks, who had interest in the area, and established the Republic of Turkey.
